name: NPR
text:
In 1965, James Baldwin and William F. Buckley debated whether the American dream "is at the expense of the American Negro." Now, the Atlantic's David Frum and Harvard's Khalil Muhammad are reimagining that debate for the March on Washington Film Festival.
https://t.co/3CJUCHDB4L

name: NPR
text:
As U.S. employers shed millions of permanent, full-time jobs, people are increasingly having to turn to freelancing as a means of survival.

And some experts say that shift is likely to continue.
https://t.co/jfejihv5vY

name: NPR
text:
Under the new deal, Oracle will host all of TikTok's U.S. user data and will safeguard TikTok's computer systems "to ensure U.S. national security requirements are fully satisfied," TikTok said in a statement.
https://t.co/flVJ8McRsK

name: NPR
text: Democratic Sen. Cory Booker, who sits on the judiciary committee, told NPR on Sunday that he believes lawmakers should let the winner of November's presidential election select a nominee. https://t.co/W0cxUqJA9g

name: NPR
text:
Over the last 40 years, nearly 90% of the live corals that once covered the Florida Reef Tract have died off. Now, researchers in South Florida have figured out a way to get coral to spawn more rapidly.
https://t.co/zvkx3YZ70k

name: NPR
text:
Frank Gehry's advice to up-and-coming architects: Don‚Äôt aim to be the next Frank Gehry ‚Äî and stay true to yourself. ‚ÄúLet your designs come naturally out of you and you'll prevail and become who you are,‚Äù he says.
https://t.co/Mv0E2vMbrz

name: NPR
text:
When Argentina went into a strict lockdown in March, photographer Celeste Alonso began documenting her life in isolation with black-and-white Polaroids.

Her use of instant images allows Alonso to exert some control in a world that seems out of control.
https://t.co/HezInhgON9

name: NPR
text:
Season 2 of Hulu's "PEN15" expands upon the exciting and traumatic themes of puberty.

Critic Aisha Harris says the comedy's co-creators have found new ways to burrow the growing pangs and embarrassments of adolescence even deeper, to cathartic effect.
https://t.co/SXZC21ExOR

name: NPR
text:
The mortality rates from COVID-19 in ICUs have been decreasing worldwide, doctors say, at least partly because of recent advances in treatment.
https://t.co/UYBIZXD5eh

name: NPR
text:
Demand has soared for outdoor programs. Numerous wilderness schools say they could double or triple their already increased programming ‚Äî and still have a waitlist.

But experts worry it could quickly become another example of learning inequality. https://t.co/bvuf2q4aTP

name: NPR
text:
ICYMI: Oaxaca, Mexico, passed a law banning the sale of junk food and soda to minors in August. Now, lawmakers in several other Mexican states are considering similar legislation.
https://t.co/TFpT3r1D34

name: NPR
text:
People returning to Fukushima after the 2011 nuclear disaster were worried about radiation levels in their soil and food. 

So they learned how to test for it.

"Anyone who faces this kind of situation has to become a scientist to survive," one woman says.
https://t.co/fh1txccmnS

name: NPR
text:
When locals returned to a rural Fukushima town after fleeing the 2011 nuclear disaster, monkeys had taken over.

"I've been worried that this village is going to become like that movie, the monkey planet one," one says. 

"I've seen it ‚Äî it could happen!‚Äù
https://t.co/oQs6iLfDzR

name: NPR
text:
Beijing is reducing Mongolian-language instruction in classrooms ‚Äî in favor of Mandarin Chinese ‚Äî in ethnic Mongolian areas of the country.

In the past decade, China has adopted similar policy changes that targeted Tibetan and Uighur education.
https://t.co/ln8X95rqak

name: NPR
text:
We asked late-night hosts and comedians @desusnice and @THEKIDMERO to list their favorite Tiny Desk concerts. Here's what they picked. 
https://t.co/pIwYgO9xGn

name: NPR
text: Host Jimmy Kimmel and everyone producing the virtual broadcast of the Emmy Awards had a pretty tough hill to climb in making it watchable. And surprisingly enough, it was. It wasn't just watchable; it was ... pretty good. https://t.co/WV7TrzgFij

name: NPR
text:
üìöBook Review: Fans of Susanna Clarke waited 16 years for her follow-up to "Jonathan Strange & Mr. Norrell."  In "Piranesi," Clarke limns a magic that is part of the very fabric of the universe.
https://t.co/tcZ5ufGyDA

name: NPR
text: Some Democrats are open to packing the Supreme Court in response to what they perceive as an illegitimate court appointment. But the move could cause a "spiral" of retaliation, experts say. https://t.co/UzFhDzyIu3

name: NPR
text:
62% of Americans feel the Supreme Court vacancy should be filled by whoever wins the presidential election, a Reuters/Ipsos poll finds.

But just over an hour after Ginsburg's death was announced, Mitch McConnell vowed to press forward on a Trump nominee.
https://t.co/IbpGD7RLmP

name: NPR
text: RT @nprmusic: Good morning (or good night, depending on where you're at) to @BTS_twt! BTS' Tiny Desk (home) concert premieres on YouTube in 45 minutes! https://t.co/IqS9xGz95P

name: NPR
text:
Nancy Pelosi on Sunday: "The president is rushing to make some kind of a decision because ... Nov. 10 is when the arguments begin on the Affordable Care Act."

"He doesn't want to crush the virus," she said. "He wants to crush the Affordable Care Act."
https://t.co/vofYdp2jjZ

name: NPR
text:
Young Americans favor Joe Biden over President Trump by 60% to 27%, according to a new Harvard poll.

The survey also found far more voters under the age of 30 say they'll "definitely" be voting, compared to 2016.
https://t.co/vG8TXGxVxY

text: RT @nprmusic: We're live, let's go! https://t.co/jfMlIRvIGO

name: NPR
text:
It's here. Watch BTS perform for the Tiny Desk's quarantine series.
https://t.co/eto3PsYN1s

name: NPR
text:
Key Democratic lawmakers are scrutinizing Trump appointee Michael Pack, CEO of USAGM.

Since starting in June, Pack has refused to extend visas for the agency's foreign workers and fired the heads of most of the networks he oversees, among other moves.
https://t.co/jkPobI164B

name: NPR
text:
President Trump says he plans to announce his nominee for the Supreme Court vacancy left by the death of Ruth Bader Ginsburg on Friday or Saturday.
https://t.co/xZaid4mH9L

name: NPR
text:
Despite blocking a hearing for Obama's Supreme Court pick for months in 2016, Mitch McConnell has vowed to press forward on Trump's choice to replace Ginsburg.

Chuck Schumer told his caucus in a Saturday night call that no options are off the table.
https://t.co/cP4TIdADos

name: NPR
text:
As if 2020 couldn't get any more contentious, the fight is underway over the late Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg's Supreme Court seat ‚Äî just 43 days until Election Day, and as some Americans are casting votes already.
https://t.co/pGO8RmVYun
